newsitem.title: USA: Digi to take $10-mln restructuring charge.
newsitem.headline: Digi to take $10-mln restructuring charge.

text.p: Digi International Inc said Thursday it will take a $10 million charge in the second quarter ending March 31 as part of a restructuring of its operations.

A company spokesman said the restructuring will affect about 20 percent of the company's 714 employees. He added that none of the company's facilities will completely shut down, but Digi plans to reduce the size of several facilities.

The moves, including increasing an emphasis on server-based communications, are expected to accelerate the company's return to profitability, Jerry Dusa, Digi's acting chief executive officer, said in a news release.

Digi, which provides data communications software and hardware, reported a loss of $2.6 million, or $0.19 a share, in the first quarter ended December 31. The company had net income of $4.5 million, or $0.33 a share, in the corresponding period in 1995.
Digi shares closed down 1/4 Thursday at eight.
